meanings.definition: To dress in a more stylish or elegant manner than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outdress her friends at parties.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outdress everyone at the event with her stunning outfit.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, she decided to outdress everyone by wearing a gown fit for a queen.
meanings.sent4: Her sense of style can outdress even the most fashionable celebrities.
meanings.sent5: With her unique fashion sense, she can outdress anyone in the room.

meanings.definition: To surpass in dressing or attire.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to outdress his colleagues for the important presentation.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer aimed to outdress all others in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as each participant tried to outdress the others.
meanings.sent4: In the fashion show, the models strived to outdress each other on the runway.
meanings.sent5: Her elegant gown managed to outdress all the other outfits at the gala.
